summary: This document is an email chain from April 2019 between Assistant U.S. Attorneys in the Southern District of New York requesting travel approval for the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The travel is for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, related to the enticement of minors for sexual activity.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Recipient of travel approval requests from AUSAs for the Epstein investigation; appears to be in a position to grant approval.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Author of the travel approval requests; is involved in the Epstein investigation and planning travel to Florida for meetings and interviews.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned as a colleague of Alex who will also be traveling for the Epstein investigation meetings in Florida.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, indicating involvement or oversight in the travel approval process for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the criminal investigation (United States v. Epstein) for enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys working together on the Epstein investigation and planning joint travel to Florida for case work.
Alex requests travel approval from Edward Tyrrell, indicating a supervisory or administrative reporting relationship.
Alex is an AUSA investigating Epstein for enticement of minors, as indicated by the case United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Travel Approval Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex requests permission for himself and Alison to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Previous Travel Approval Request
events.description: An earlier travel approval request was sent for the same Epstein case, planning travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews.

keyFacts: The document confirms active investigation work by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York into Jeffrey Epstein (case United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618) as of April 2019.
The investigation relates to 'enticement of minors for sexual activity,' specifying the nature of the charges.
Prosecutors were traveling to Florida (West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale) for meetings and interviews, indicating key witnesses, evidence, or law enforcement contacts were located there.
The email chain shows internal DOJ procedures for travel approval in high-profile investigations.
The document is dated after Epstein's 2019 arrest, showing continued investigative activity leading up to his prosecution.
